channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report E-2024030584
item.description:
Report E-2024030584

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: BRANDON
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 20, 2024, one (1) 2.5-gallon jug of UN1791 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged jug, all UN1791 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024031288
item.description:
Report X-2024031288

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024031288 SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND INSIDE OF THE LOADING TRAILER. DescribePack: THE LEAKAGE WAS ABSORBED THROUGHOUT THE CARDBOARD BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY HANDLED USING THE CORRECT HAZARDOUS MATERIALS NEEDED AT THE TIME. 2. X-2024031297 SequenceEvent: THE HAZMAT WAS FOUND LEAKING IN UNLOAD AND WAS PUT INSIDE A TOTE. USING THE CORRECT HAZARDOUS MATERIALS. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS DAMAGED FROM THE SPILLAGE FROM THE CONTAINERS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS HANDLED PROPERLY.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was on door A224, under the IC rollers. The bottom corner of the pail was punctured causing the content to leak out.. DescribePack: The bottom corner of the pail was punctured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The pail was placed upside down to stop further leakage and placed in a plastic bag. Oil dri was used to clean the spill.

item.title: Report E-2024030522
item.description:
Report E-2024030522

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: VICKSBURG
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K STORE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 150-gallons of gasoline were released impacting concrete and nearby soil. The spill occurred when the driver opened the drop head on his tanker trailer and accidentally overfilled it, causing approximately 150-gallons of gasoline to spill out. The driver deployed boom while waiting for assistance. The police and the fire department were notified and in route. The Fire Department responded and put down absorbents. The state of Mississippi was notified of the incident, but no report number could be provided by Catherine Bell. E3 Environmental arrived on site and swept-in absorbents solidifying released material on the impacted concrete. E3 Environmental scraped the surface of the impacted soil area and sprayed with microblaze. the impacted absorbents and soil were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report E-2024020355
item.description:
Report E-2024020355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T00:34:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: PICAYUNE
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MC Tank Transport
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2301 ET, MC Tank Transport contacted ERTS to report a release of 5 gallons so far out of a 7000 gallon tank of regulated UN3455 Cresols was released impacting asphalt only no storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted. ERTS dispatched E3 to the site to perform the clean up and tank transfer. E3 arrived on site and with proper hazmat attire advised an estimated 30 gallons were released to a 8ft by 8ft area of asphalt. E3 contained the spill then conducted the tank transfer, once completed the team will work on the asphalt area. The relief tank and damaged tanker were removed from the site with approval from MS DEQ. The impacted area was scraped with shovels, soda ash was applied to the area and then collected it. There was a second asphalt area impacted that was 3ft x 3ft where the driver entered the property this area was cleaned up. three poly drums of impacted solids were generated and will be staged at 3421 Industrial Rd Pascagoula MS until profiled and properly disposed of.
